title: Gated-Attention Readers for Text Comprehension
authors:
Dhingra, Bhuwan  and
Liu, Hanxiao  and
Yang, Zhilin  and
Cohen, William  and
Salakhutdinov, Ruslan
venue: Proceedings of the 55th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics (Volume 1: Long Papers)
abstract: In this paper we study the problem of answering cloze-style questions over documents. Our model, the Gated-Attention (GA) Reader, integrates a multi-hop architecture with a novel attention mechanism, which is based on multiplicative interactions between the query embedding and the intermediate states of a recurrent neural network document reader. This enables the reader to build query-specific representations of tokens in the document for accurate answer selection. The GA Reader obtains state-of-the-art results on three benchmarks for this taskâ€“the CNN & Daily Mail news stories and the Who Did What dataset. The effectiveness of multiplicative interaction is demonstrated by an ablation study, and by comparing to alternative compositional operators for implementing the gated-attention.
